paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 gene variant c.G1681A, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Differentiation of hiPSCs produced beating clusters within 8–16 days, which contained cardiomyocytes as evidenced by characteristic cardiac muscle striations.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Asymptomatic carrier of the same mutation
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient's mother (asymptomatic carrier of same mutation, not under β-blocker treatment).

functional_data.summary: The c.G1681A mutation in KCNH2 leads to impaired glycosylation and channel transport, resulting in prolonged action potential durations and increased susceptibility to arrhythmias.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in the family, with the mother being an asymptomatic carrier.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the potential for allele-specific RNA interference as a therapeutic approach.
key_quotes: Allele-specific RNA interference directed towards the mutated KCNH2 mRNA caused knockdown, while leaving the wild-type mRNA unaffected.
Over 500 hERG mutations are identified, which primarily show autosomal-dominant-negative inheritance.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the KCNH2 variant was extracted thoroughly.
